examples: It's completely analogous to this.
Now we know the answer: It’s analogous.
It's completely analogous to what's here.
It’s kind of analogous to what the Russians do inside Russia to foreign journalists and foreign diplomats.
So Surveyor 1 and its kin were a lot more analogous to future human landings, because of the weight of the craft.
words.defineEn: able to be compared with another thing due to sharing a similar feature, nature, etc.
words.defineVi: có thể được so sánh với một thứ khác do chia sẻ một tính năng, bản chất tương tự, v.v.

examples: It has provided the disparate opposition an opportunity to come together and rake the government over the coals.
Is their disparate impact?
Is their disparate impact?
It has a disparate impact on people from low income communities and on women and moms.
Different branches used disparate methodology to pursue their own goals.
words.defineEn: not sharing any form of similarity
words.defineVi: không chia sẻ bất kỳ hình thức tương đồng

words.defineEn: fading out of existence, mind, or sight quickly
words.defineVi: biến mất khỏi sự tồn tại, tâm trí hoặc tầm nhìn một cách nhanh chóng

words.defineEn: behaving or moving in an awkward or ungraceful manner, particularly due to being tall
words.defineVi: cư xử hoặc di chuyển một cách vụng về hoặc vô duyên, đặc biệt là do cao

words.defineEn: (of people) having gray or white hair, particularly due to age
words.defineVi: (của người) có tóc màu xám hoặc trắng, đặc biệt là do tuổi tác

examples: So we get our indeterminate form.
All of these are indeterminate, undefined forms.
So this is our indeterminate form.
So these are the two indeterminate forms.
That assertion has a truth value, but it’s indeterminate, because the show’s not over yet.
words.defineEn: not known, measured, or specified precisely
words.defineVi: không được biết, đo lường hoặc chỉ định chính xác

words.defineEn: beyond imitation due to being unique and of high quality
words.defineVi: không thể bắt chước do độc đáo và chất lượng cao

examples: Golem’s story is as malleable as the clay from which it was formed
Though certain features of a person’s behavior may remain relatively stable over time, others are malleable, moulded by our upbringing, life experiences, and age.
What comes out the other end is a malleable sheet that can be molded and cut into different shapes.
Extraversion seems to be one of the more malleable traits out there.
It's highly malleable, meaning it can be deformed or changed without fracturing the material.
words.defineEn: capable of being shaped or bent or drawn out
words.defineVi: có khả năng được định hình hoặc uốn cong hoặc kéo ra

examples: Discord's growth isn't meteoric.
Robo-advisors have had a meteoric rise in popularity since their debut in 2008.
His team has studied JUUL’s meteoric rise, assembling a website featuring 1,400 JUUL advertisements.
Avocado started its meteoric comeback at the turn of the millennium, and it was helped by an unlikely political decision.
It's the true story of the meteoric rise and subsequent fall of Marvel comics and the star cross creators behind the panel, Stan Lee and Jack Kirby.
words.defineEn: developing or reaching success in a quick way
words.defineVi: phát triển hoặc đạt được thành công một cách nhanh chóng

words.defineEn: letting light pass through, thus extremely clear
words.defineVi: để ánh sáng đi qua, do đó cực kỳ rõ ràng

words.defineEn: inclined to change in form, nature, etc. frequently
words.defineVi: có xu hướng thay đổi thường xuyên về hình thức, tính chất, v.v.

examples: Kahlo's sartorial choices not only expressed her identity and ideals, but also accommodated her disabilities, covering the braces and plaster cast she often had to wear and distract it from them.
Have any other resources to share on the origins of Santa’s sartorial choices?
words.defineEn: referring to clothing, particularly men's clothing, or the manner in which it is tailored or worn
words.defineVi: đề cập đến quần áo, đặc biệt là quần áo nam giới, hoặc cách thức mà nó được may hoặc mặc

words.defineEn: possessing a combination of intelligence, excitement, and appeal
words.defineVi: sở hữu sự kết hợp của trí thông minh, sự phấn khích và hấp dẫn

examples: The widening wealth gap between the rich and the poor is a stark reminder that half the world knows not how the other half lives.
The announcement drove fans stark raving mad, as it will be the first new album the band has released in over 10 years.
That noise is going to drive me stark raving mad.
For heaven's sake Bruce, have you gone stark raving mad?
It was very stark.
words.defineEn: extremely obvious and simple, usually unpleasant as well
words.defineVi: cực kỳ rõ ràng và đơn giản, thường cũng khó chịu

examples: The third telltale sign of depression is indecisiveness.
But there's another telltale sign, too.
Companies like Louis Vuitton and Gucci train Steve on the telltale signs for spotting a fake.

Although they looked different from today’s marine arthropods - like lobsters, crabs, and shrimps - radiodonts had some telltale arthropod features, like a tough exoskeleton, a segmented body, gills, and appendages with joints.
And he said, that's a real telltale sign.
words.defineEn: suggesting or indicating something, particularly something unnoticeable or secret
words.defineVi: đề nghị hoặc chỉ ra một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là một cái gì đó không đáng chú ý hoặc bí mật

examples: Whereas with aviation, it's a much more tractable technical problem and you have a regulatory environment that is ready to go.
words.defineEn: easily managed (controlled or taught or molded)
words.defineVi: dễ dàng quản lý (kiểm soát hoặc dạy hoặc đúc)

words.defineEn: lacking appeal or noticeability
words.defineVi: thiếu hấp dẫn hoặc đáng chú ý

examples: Once all of those macromolecules have been dissembled into their monomers, the small intestine’s epithelial cells can finally absorb and transport them through your capillaries and into the bloodstream, where they can travel to pretty much to any cell in your body, and be used to build collagen, or store fat, or replace dying cells.
words.defineEn: to conceal one's true emotions, beliefs, intentions, etc. and display a false one
words.defineVi: để che giấu cảm xúc, niềm tin, ý định thực sự của một người, v.v. và thể hiện một điều sai trái

examples: And we basically embellished our lives.
These stories may be embellished and depict Sparta at the apex of its power, so take them with a grain of salt.
Vasari made errors and loved to embellish stories.
But I cannot think of a single public institution that is strengthened, embellished, enhanced by this administration, where public trust, public confidence has been increased.
For instance, these $3,595 Louboutins are embellished with Swarovski Crystals.
words.defineEn: to improve the appearance of something by adding things such as decorative pieces, colors, etc. to it
words.defineVi: để cải thiện vẻ ngoài của một cái gì đó bằng cách thêm những thứ như mảnh trang trí, màu sắc, v.v.

words.defineEn: to make someone or something appear as ridiculous, stupid, or absurd
words.defineVi: để làm cho một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó xuất hiện như lố bịch, ngu ngốc, hoặc ngớ ngẩn

words.defineEn: the greatest stage or point that something has reached
words.defineVi: giai đoạn lớn nhất hoặc điểm mà một cái gì đó đã đạt được

examples: But early school buses were a hodgepodge of different styles and types of vehicles.
Groups of night watchmen and patrols often worked under a hodgepodge of different systems depending on their geographical locations.

In all, the president's campaign and allies have initiated legal actions in six battleground states, employing a hodgepodge of debunked allegations that range from voting equipment conspiracies to supposed improprieties by election clerks.
It's kind of neglected and really just, like, small and a hodgepodge of items.

We’ll outline the flawed intelligence and tactical mistakes of a hodgepodge team of officers, their failure to properly announce their presence at Taylor’s, the chaos and excessive use of force that ensued.
words.defineEn: a random mixture of dissimilar or diverse things
words.defineVi: một hỗn hợp ngẫu nhiên của những thứ không giống nhau hoặc đa dạng

examples: Fiction engages the senses, helps us create vivid mental simulacra of the experiences the characters are having.
words.defineEn: a thing or person that represents or resembles something or someone
words.defineVi: một điều hoặc người đại diện hoặc tương tự như một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó
